name: Abdullah Ahmadzai
analysis: Standard seamer.

name: Azmatullah Omarzai
analysis: Gem! Swings new ball, bats with power. Proper all-rounder.

name: Darwish Rasooli
analysis: Not enough impact.

name: Fazalhaq Farooqi
analysis: Lethal in powerplay; swings it to destroy top order.

name: Gulbadin Naib
analysis: Strong as an ox, "Vibes" player; inconsistent skills.

name: Ibrahim Zadran
analysis: The anchor; technically solid, prevents collapses.

name: Mohammad Ishaq
analysis: Keeper without the batting stats.

name: Mohammad Nabi
analysis: "The President"; vast experience, safe pair of hands, slowing down.

name: Mujeeb Ur Rahman
analysis: Mystery fading, fitness erratic; high risk.

name: Naveen-ul-Haq
analysis: Master of slower balls; clever at the death.

name: Noor Ahmad
analysis: Left-arm wrist spin is gold; batters struggle to pick him.

name: Rahmanullah Gurbaz
analysis: Fire and ice (mostly fire); dangerous opener who attacks early.

name: Rashid Khan
analysis: MVP of T20; bats, fields, best spinner on planet. Home conditions.

name: Sediqullah Atal
analysis: Young talent, not ready yet.

name: Shahidullah Kamal
analysis: Squad player only.

name: Adam Zampa
analysis: The best white-ball spinner in the world? He takes wickets when nothing else is happening.

name: Cameron Green
analysis: Immense talent, but his back issues and high price tag make him a risky investment.

name: Cooper Connolly
analysis: A young talent for the future, but maybe a bit light for a heavy-duty squad right now.

name: Glenn Maxwell
analysis: The Big Show! On turning tracks, his off-spin becomes a genuine weapon alongside his bat.

name: Josh Hazlewood
analysis: Metronome! He lands the ball on a coin; boringly consistent and effective everywhere.

name: Josh Inglis
analysis: Innovative and modern; plays the sweep and reverse sweep beautifully against spin.

name: Marcus Stoinis
analysis: The Hulk! Muscles the ball over ropes and bowls heavy balls that stick in the pitch.

name: Matthew Kuhnemann
analysis: A decent left-arm spinner, but with Zampa/Maxwell there, he rarely gets a look in.

name: Matthew Short
analysis: Dominated the BBL but has struggled to replicate that form in international cricket.

name: Mitchell Marsh
analysis: The Bison is a beast with the bat, but if he isn't bowling, he is an expensive luxury.

name: Nathan Ellis
analysis: Skiddy bowler with a great back-of-the-hand slower ball; ideal for Asian conditions.

name: Pat Cummins
analysis: The Silencer! He knows how to win trophies; his cutters are deadly on slow pitches.

name: Tim David
analysis: Pure power who doesn't need sighters; risky on turners but deadly on flat decks.

name: Travis Head
analysis: He attacks in the Powerplay before the ball starts gripping; takes the pitch out of the equation!

name: Xavier Bartlett
analysis: Swing king from the BBL! A fantastic budget option for new ball wickets.

name: Litton Das
analysis: Looks like a million dollars, then throws it away; frustrating talent.

name: Mahedi Hasan
analysis: Utility cricketer; bowls flat off-spin and can swing the bat, average at both.

name: Mustafizur Rahman
analysis: "The Fizz"! On slow pitches, he is a king; cutters are his key weapon.

name: Nasum Ahmed
analysis: Powerplay dart master; bowls tight lines but rarely runs through a side.

name: Nurul Hasan
analysis: Brilliant keeper, arguably the best in BD, but batting is barely serviceable.

name: Parvez Hossain Emon
analysis: Young top-order batter; not consistent enough to warrant a bid.

name: Rishad Hossain
analysis: A tall leg-spinner from Bangladesh? Rare commodity and a wicket-taker!

name: Saif Hassan
analysis: Tried and tested, but hasn't succeeded at T20I level.

name: Shaif Uddin
analysis: Has been around for a while but pace has dropped; average all-rounder.

name: Shamim Hossain
analysis: Lefty finisher who has struggled to finish games effectively.

name: Shoriful Islam
analysis: Aggressive left-armer who swings it upfront; good for early wickets.

name: Tanzid Hasan
analysis: Young opener who attacks, but lacks the temperament for big innings.

name: Tanzim Sakib
analysis: Aggressive pacer, sometimes too much; prone to leaking runs.

name: Taskin Ahmed
analysis: Heart and pace! The best pacer Bangladesh has right now; genuine wicket-taker.

name: Tawhid Hridoy
analysis: Best young batter in Bangladesh; rotates strike well and plays spin smartly.

name: Ajayveer Hundal
analysis: Not auction ready.

name: Ansh Patel
analysis: Young spinner, too raw.

name: Dilon Heyliger
analysis: Can hit long ball, bowl medium pace; bits and pieces.

name: Dilpreet Bajwa
analysis: Hard-hitter, but inconsistent; pool is too deep.

name: Harsh Thaker
analysis: Steady but lacks explosive power.

name: Jaskarandeep Buttar
analysis: Backup pacer.

name: Kaleem Sana
analysis: Decent left-arm pacer; bench warmer here.

name: Kanwarpal Tathgur
analysis: Not enough exposure.

name: Navneet Dhaliwal
analysis: Good opener for Canada; bench option.

name: Nicholas Kirton
analysis: Lefty with class; impressive in World Cup. Worth a punt.

name: Ravinderpal Singh
analysis: Hitter but no consistency.

name: Saad Bin Zafar
analysis: Experienced; economical spinner but doesn't take many wickets.

name: Shivam Sharma
analysis: Spinner without variations.

name: Shreyas Movva
analysis: Average keeper-bat.

name: Yuvraj Samra
analysis: Domestic level player.

name: Adil Rashid
analysis: The Wizard! Slower through the air; he is England's biggest weapon in Asia.

name: Ben Duckett
analysis: Sweeps everything! Good against spin, but struggles against raw pace.

name: Harry Brook
analysis: Modern genius! Shots all around the ground; a pillar for your batting lineup.

name: Jacob Bethell
analysis: The next big thing! Dynamic talent and spin bowling all-rounder.

name: Jamie Overton
analysis: Fast bowling all-rounder who hits massive sixes; impact player.

name: Jofra Archer
analysis: Elite skill, fragile body; a high-risk investment but terrifying if fit.

name: Jos Buttler
analysis: Jos the Boss! IPL legend who knows these pitches better than most; essential pick.

name: Josh Tongue
analysis: Red-ball specialist; not suited for the T20 format.

name: Liam Dawson
analysis: The "Professor" of spin; highly skilled, restricts runs, and a smart pick.

name: Luke Wood
analysis: Left-arm pace is always in demand, but can be predictable; decent backup.

name: Phil Salt
analysis: Brutal against pace! If the pitch is flat, he wins the match in the first 6 overs.

name: Rehan Ahmed
analysis: Young leggie with swagger; a good option for turning tracks.

name: Sam Curran
analysis: Uses cutters well; good for sticky wickets and a clutch lower-order batter.

name: Tom Banton
analysis: Hockey shots on a cricket field; talented but inconsistent.

name: Will Jacks
analysis: Explosive bat and handy off-spin; a complete package for T20s.

name: Abhishek Sharma
analysis: Explosive talent who hits hard, but sometimes the fuse burns out a little too quickly!

name: Arshdeep Singh
analysis: The King of Swing upfront and the Prince of Yorkers at the death; extremely reliable left-arm gold.

name: Axar Patel
analysis: "Bapu" is everywhere! He bowls powerplay, he bats in the clutch, and he fields like a panther.

name: Hardik Pandya
analysis: The ultimate clutch player; when the pressure cooker whistles, Hardik cooks the opposition!

name: Harshit Rana
analysis: Aggressive and in-your-face! He has the skills, but needs to control his emotions and line.

name: Ishan Kishan
analysis: Pocket dynamo who loves pace on the ball, but might struggle if the pitch is turning square.

name: Jasprit Bumrah
analysis: The Cheat Code of cricket; batters don't try to hit him, they just try to survive him!

name: Kuldeep Yadav
analysis: A magician who spins a web; on Asian pitches, he is more dangerous than a loose tiger!

name: Rinku Singh
analysis: Lord Rinku! Ice in his veins; if you need 20 off the last over, he is the only man you call.

name: Sanju Samson
analysis: Poetry in motion when he hits, a tragedy when he misses; consistency is the only missing puzzle piece.

name: Shivam Dube
analysis: The "Spin Destroyer"! He doesn't use feet, he uses muscle to deposit spinners into the second tier.

name: Suryakumar Yadav
analysis: Supla shot specialist! He plays with the fielders' minds; if he stays for 30 balls, the match is finished.

name: Tilak Varma
analysis: A modern-day elegant lefty who plays spin late and hits boundaries with pure timing.

name: Varun Chakaravarthy
analysis: The mystery is back and it's baffling batters! If the pitch has grip, he runs through lineups.

name: Washington Sundar
analysis: Tall, lanky, and stingy! He bowls tight off-spin in the powerplay and frustrates the openers.

name: Barry McCarthy
analysis: Famous for that boundary save, but his bowling can be fodder for big hitters.

name: Ben Calitz
analysis: Not a known commodity in international T20s yet.

name: Ben White
analysis: A leg-spinner, useful in Asia, but often bowls too short; needs control.

name: Craig Young
analysis: A hit-the-deck bowler who gets bounce, but lacks variation; good depth player.

name: Curtis Campher
analysis: A scrappy cricketer who fights hard with bat and ball; took 4 wickets in 4 balls once!

name: Gareth Delany
analysis: Leg spin is okay, batting is thin; good fielder but average recently.

name: George Dockrell
analysis: Reinvented himself from a spinner to a finisher; smart, but lacks power.

name: Harry Tector
analysis: A technically gifted player who plays spin beautifully; a touch of class anchor.

name: Josh Little
analysis: IPL quality left-armer! Hits the pitch hard and is reliable; a steal.

name: Lorcan Tucker
analysis: A very busy player who loves the scoop shot; keeps the scoreboard moving well.

name: Mark Adair
analysis: A genuine wicket-taker who breaks partnerships and can whack sixes at the end.

name: Matthew Humphreys
analysis: Young left-arm spinner; a project player who could be handy on turners.

name: Paul Stirling
analysis: "Stirlo" is an Irish giant! Hits spin hard, but age and fitness are catching up.

name: Ross Adair
analysis: Paul's brother; aggressive but very hit-or-miss; a gamble for the opening slot.

name: Tim Tector
analysis: Harry's younger brother; still developing and not ready for this stage.

name: Ali Hasan
analysis: Not threatening enough for top batters.

name: Anthony Mosca
analysis: Not auction material.

name: Benjamin Manenti
analysis: Sibling of Harry; doesn't offer enough with bat or ball.

name: Crishan Jorge
analysis: Needs more seasoning.

name: Gian Piero Meade
analysis: Just a squad filler; pass.

name: Grant Stewart
analysis: County pro (Kent); decent hitter, but not an international star.

name: Harry Manenti
analysis: Utility player, not a starter for a fantasy XI.

name: JJ Smuts
analysis: Solid domestic player (ex-SA); offers stability and spin, decent backup.

name: Jaspreet Singh
analysis: Average medium pacer.

name: Justin Mosca
analysis: Sibling duo, but neither makes the cut.

name: Marcus Campopiano
analysis: Club level stats don't translate to this level.

name: Syed Naqvi
analysis: Pass; too raw.

name: Thomas Draca
analysis: Not enough data to justify a spot in a competitive auction.

name: Wayne Madsen
analysis: County cricket legend, but entering his 40s; too old for a dynamic T20 squad.

name: Zain Ali
analysis: Too inexperienced for this stage.

name: Ben Shikongo
analysis: A backup seamer who tries hard but lacks the weapons to trouble top batters.

name: Bernard Scholtz
analysis: A disciplined left-arm spinner who rarely bowls a loose ball; good for economy rates.

name: Dylan Leicher
analysis: A developmental all-rounder; keep an eye on him for the future, but skip for now.

name: Gerhard Erasmus
analysis: The backbone of Namibia! He bowls spin, anchors the chase, and captains brilliantly.

name: JC Balt
analysis: Very new to the scene; hasn't shown enough at this level to justify a bid.

name: JJ Smit
analysis: A hard hitter of the cricket ball, but injuries have limited his bowling recently.

name: Jack Brassell
analysis: A young kid learning his trade; not ready for the firing line of a big auction.

name: Jan Frylinck
analysis: Very clever bowler with lots of slower balls; effective on sluggish surfaces.

name: Louren Steenkamp
analysis: A domestic performer who hasn't quite made the step up to dominate international attacks.

name: Malan Kruger
analysis: Similar to Steenkamp, decent technique but lacks the power game for elite T20.

name: Max Heingo
analysis: Another backup bowling option; only buy if you are building a Namibia-specific XI.

name: Nicol Loftie-Eaton
analysis: Holds the fastest T20I century record! Inconsistent, but has huge X-factor potential.

name: Ruben Trumpelmann
analysis: Dangerous with the new ball! If it swings, he can take 2-3 wickets in the powerplay.

name: WP Myburgh
analysis: A squad player for Namibia, unlikely to break into a fantasy 15-man squad.

name: Zane Green
analysis: A safe keeper but his strike rate is painfully slow; avoids rotating strike.

name: Aarif Sheikh
analysis: Stabilizer, not a match winner.

name: Aasif Sheikh
analysis: A steady opener/keeper; decent backup but T20 demands more.

name: Basir Ahamad
analysis: Jack of all trades, master of none.

name: Dipendra Singh Airee
analysis: The "Tiger"! Gun fielder, handy bowler, and explosive finisher; cult hero.

name: Gulshan Jha
analysis: Very young talent; high potential as a hitter, but raw.

name: Karan KC
analysis: Known for lusty blows and wickets, but can be expensive.

name: Kushal Bhurtel
analysis: Aggressive opener who lives by the sword; hit or miss.

name: Lalit Rajbanshi
analysis: A tidy left-arm spinner on turning tracks; offers good control.

name: Lokesh Bam
analysis: Hitter but no technique.

name: Nandan Yadav
analysis: Doesn't have the pace.

name: Rohit Paudel
analysis: Young captain of Nepal; solid technique and anchors well, but struggles to accelerate.

name: Sandeep Lamichhane
analysis: Proven wicket-taker globally, but lack of recent top-tier game time is risky.

name: Sher Malla
analysis: Backup spinner; avoid.

name: Sompal Kami
analysis: Veteran all-rounder for Nepal; backup option at best.

name: Sundeep Jora
analysis: Not consistent enough.

name: Aryan Dutt
analysis: A tall off-spinner who isn't afraid to bowl in the powerplay; very annoying for batters!

name: Bas de Leede
analysis: The Flying Dutchman! Bowls heavy pace at the death and bats in the top 4; huge value.

name: Colin Ackermann
analysis: A solid county pro who gives stability with the bat and bowls useful off-spin.

name: Fred Klaassen
analysis: A decent left-arm pacer, but lacks the X-factor to trouble top-tier international batters.

name: Kyle Klein
analysis: Very young and raw; he is one for the future, not for your high-stakes auction today.

name: Logan van Beek
analysis: Super Over hero! He brings incredible energy, wickets at the death, and handy runs.

name: Max O'Dowd
analysis: A fighter who anchors the innings, but often eats up too many dot balls for T20s.

name: Michael Levitt
analysis: Showed clean hitting ability, a decent wildcard punt if you need an aggressive opener cheap.

name: Noah Croes
analysis: A young backup keeper; buy him only if you have absolutely no money left for a backup.

name: Paul van Meekeren
analysis: Fast and skiddy, but can be very erratic with his line and length.

name: Roelof van der Merwe
analysis: The Bulldog! He has more passion than skill at this age, but fights hard on turning tracks.

name: Saqib Zulfiqar
analysis: A bits-and-pieces leg-spinner who doesn't offer enough impact to warrant a slot.

name: Scott Edwards
analysis: Captain Courageous! He sweeps everything and is the backbone of the Dutch batting lineup.

name: Timm van der Gugten
analysis: Experienced campaigner, but his pace has dropped significantly; batter fodder on good tracks.

name: Zach Lion-Cachet
analysis: A developmental player; save your money for someone who will definitely play.

name: Kyle Jamieson
analysis: Fast but very injury-prone; risky backup pacer.

name: Daryl Mitchell
analysis: Tough cookie; uses feet well against spin. Clutch player.

name: Devon Conway
analysis: Mr. Reliable; masters spin and bats through while others hit.

name: Finn Allen
analysis: Hits to moon or gets out first ball; frustrating but explosive.

name: Glenn Phillips
analysis: Super-athlete; keeps, bowls off-spin, fields like a leopard. Utility.

name: Ish Sodhi
analysis: Tall leg-spinner; turns it, but bowls one bad ball per over.

name: Jacob Duffy
analysis: Domestic stalwart; squad filler internationally.

name: James Neesham
analysis: T20 freelancer; can win a game, but consistency is enemy.

name: Lockie Ferguson
analysis: Express pace, fragile body; dangerous if he plays.

name: Mark Chapman
analysis: Solid middle-order player; plays spin well. Flies under the radar.

name: Matt Henry
analysis: Brilliant new-ball bowler; consistent wickets in the powerplay.

name: Michael Bracewell
analysis: "The Beast"; hits clean and bowls tight off-spin. Underrated.

name: Mitchell Santner
analysis: The most economical bowler? Never gives easy runs. Smart batter.

name: Rachin Ravindra
analysis: Breakout star! Classy batting, useful spin. The future.

name: Tim Seifert
analysis: Cheeky player; loves the scoop. Good backup keeper.

name: Ashish Odedara
analysis: Too inexperienced.

name: Hammad Mirza
analysis: Not enough impact to warrant a slot in your team.

name: Hasnain Ali Shah
analysis: Standard medium pacer; no variety.

name: Jatinder Singh
analysis: Famous for his muscle-man celebration, but his batting is often slow and scratchy.

name: Jay Odedra
analysis: Part-timer quality; avoid.

name: Jiten Ramanandi
analysis: Bits and pieces, but not enough bits.

name: Karan Sonavale
analysis: Not good enough for this auction.

name: Mohammad Nadeem
analysis: A steady bowler and batter, but lacks the X-factor for fantasy points.

name: Nadeem Khan
analysis: Doesn't have the power game for modern T20s.

name: Shafiq Jan
analysis: Not ready for this level.

name: Shah Faisal
analysis: Average pace, no swing; easy to line up.

name: Shakeel Ahmad
analysis: Slow left-arm orthodox; only useful on a raging turner.

name: Sufyan Mehmood
analysis: Average seamer; doesn't threaten the stumps enough.

name: Vinayak Shukla
analysis: A domestic performer, but untested against the big boys.

name: Wasim Ali
analysis: Squad player only; doesn't offer enough value.

name: Abbas Afridi
analysis: A variation specialist with a good back-of-the-hand slower ball; useful on slow decks.

name: Abrar Ahmed
analysis: "Harry Potter" with the mystery spin! A massive asset on subcontinent pitches where batters struggle to pick him.

name: Azam Khan
analysis: Hits spin hard, but his fitness and struggle against high pace make him a liability.

name: Babar Azam
analysis: A classic run-machine; on tough, slow pitches, his stability is worth its weight in gold.

name: Fakhar Zaman
analysis: Fakhar-e-Pakistan! A high-risk, high-reward spin hitter; if he stays for 10 balls, he changes the game.

name: Haris Rauf
analysis: Fast as a bullet train, but sometimes travels the distance if he doesn't use his cutters properly.

name: Iftikhar Ahmed
analysis: "Chacha" brings experience and handy off-spin, but his power hitting has faded recently.

name: Imad Wasim
analysis: Very smart cricketer; his arm-balls in the powerplay are impossible to hit on turning tracks.

name: Mohammad Amir
analysis: Vintage class! He still has the angles and the cutters to fool batters in the death overs.

name: Mohammad Rizwan
analysis: The Energizer Bunny! He runs hard, sweeps everything, and guarantees you fantasy points every match.

name: Naseem Shah
analysis: Pace is pace, yaar! He has speed, swing, and a big heart to bowl the tough overs.

name: Saim Ayub
analysis: Stylish "no-look" shots are great, but he needs to look at the scoreboard and build an innings.

name: Shadab Khan
analysis: Currently out of form and bowling full tosses, but he bats well and is a gun fielder.

name: Shaheen Afridi
analysis: The Eagle strikes early! His first over swinging yorker is the most dangerous event in cricket.

name: Usman Khan
analysis: Knows UAE conditions inside out; he attacks from ball one but needs international consistency.

name: Aiden Markram
analysis: Classy batter and astute captain; bowls useful off-spin. Safe pick.

name: Anrich Nortje
analysis: Fastest in the world when fit, but rusty after injuries. Pace can be used against him.

name: Corbin Bosch
analysis: Fringe player; not enough X-factor.

name: David Miller
analysis: "Killer Miller"; finishes games for fun. Big match player.

name: Dewald Brevis
analysis: "Baby AB"; huge talent, but inconsistent. High ceiling.

name: Donovan Ferreira
analysis: Multi-utility; keeps, bowls off-spin, hits miles. Value!

name: George Linde
analysis: Solid left-arm spinning all-rounder, but unspectacular.

name: Heinrich Klaasen
analysis: The best spin-basher in the world; terrifying to bowl to. MVP material.

name: Kagiso Rabada
analysis: Rabada ka wada! Pace, bounce, and wickets; leader of the pack.

name: Keshav Maharaj
analysis: Disciplined captain; strangles batters in powerplay. Reliable.

name: Kwena Maphaka
analysis: 17-year-old prodigy! Fast left-arm pace; X-factor surprise.

name: Lungi Ngidi
analysis: Good slower ball, but struggles with rhythm; risky middle-tier pacer.

name: Marco Jansen
analysis: 7-foot giant; swings new ball, hits massive sixes. Complete package.

name: Quinton de Kock
analysis: Match-winner! Loves Asia; explosive starts guaranteed.

name: Tony de Zorzi
analysis: Better suited to ODIs than T20s.

name: Charith Asalanka
analysis: A gritty middle-order player who plays spin well, but lacks the power hitting.

name: Dasun Shanaka
analysis: Captaincy kept him in the team, but batting has dipped; slower balls are still useful.

name: Dhananjaya de Silva
analysis: A classical player suited for Tests/ODIs; consumes too many balls in T20s.

name: Dunith Wellalage
analysis: Young talent with a calm head; left-arm spin is tidy but batting needs power.

name: Janith Liyanage
analysis: A seam-bowling all-rounder who hasn't quite cracked the T20 code yet; avoid.

name: Kamindu Mendis
analysis: Ambidextrous spin! He can bowl both off-spin and left-arm spin; made for these conditions.

name: Kusal Mendis
analysis: When he is hot, he sizzles; when he is cold, he freezes; frustratingly inconsistent.

name: Kusal Perera
analysis: Explosive lefty who plays like Jayasuriya on his day, but is made of glass (injury prone).

name: Maheesh Theekshana
analysis: Mystery spin in the powerplay? Yes please! In Asia, he is a nightmare to face early on.

name: Matheesha Pathirana
analysis: Baby Malinga! His slingy action is very hard to pick under lights in dew conditions.

name: Milan Rathnayake
analysis: A newer face with raw pace but lacks control; probably not worth a bid.

name: Niroshan Dickwella
analysis: He will play a scoop shot on the first ball and get out; entertains for 2 mins only.

name: Nuwan Thushara
analysis: Malinga 2.0! If you can't afford Pathirana, buy Thushara; deadly on low-bounce pitches.

name: Pathum Nissanka
analysis: The silent warrior! While others collapse, he scores crucial runs; very reliable.

name: Wanindu Hasaranga
analysis: 4 overs of gold in Asia! Plus he can pinch-hit; if the ball turns, he is unplayable.

name: Aayan Afzal Khan
analysis: Very young, smart left-arm spinner; good value.

name: Akash Tahir
analysis: Backup spinner.

name: Ali Naseer
analysis: Young all-rounder with potential; watch him.

name: Alishan Sharafu
analysis: Young talent; looks good but doesn't score big enough.

name: Aryan Lakra
analysis: Not enough impact.

name: Asif Khan
analysis: Power hitter; inconsistent in T20s despite ODI records.

name: Basil Hameed
analysis: Steady off-spinner; nothing flashy.

name: Junaid Siddique
analysis: Aggressive pacer; good yorkers but loses cool.

name: Karthik Meiyappan
analysis: Leggie; hat-trick hero vs SL, decent option.

name: Muhammad Jawadullah
analysis: Left-arm seamer; decent prospect.

name: Muhammad Waseem
analysis: Best Associate batter? Hits sixes for fun. Budget opener.

name: Rohan Mustafa
analysis: Veteran, past his best but experienced.

name: Sanchit Sharma
analysis: Average seamer.

name: Vriitya Aravind
analysis: Technically sound but too slow for T20; anchor.

name: Zahoor Khan
analysis: Slower balls are decent; decent backup.

name: Aaron Jones
analysis: "Jones the Giant"! He has immense power and hits huge sixes, but goes missing often.

name: Abhishek Paradkar
analysis: A young left-arm seamer; needs more exposure before he becomes a viable pick.

name: Ali Khan
analysis: The Yorker machine! Great for death overs, but needs to be accurate on slow pitches.

name: Andries Gous
analysis: A classy batter with South African roots; plays both pace and spin very well.

name: Harmeet Singh
analysis: Left-arm spin and lusty blows; knows Indian pitches well from his domestic days.

name: Jasdeep Singh
analysis: An honest trier who bowls medium pace, but lacks the quality for this level.

name: Juanoy Drysdale
analysis: Raw pace talent, but without experience, he is a liability in pressure situations.

name: Milind Kumar
analysis: Ranji veteran who brings stability, but plays T20s at a slightly slower ODI tempo.

name: Monank Patel
analysis: A solid anchor who captained USA to glory; safe pair of hands but limited power.

name: Nosthush Kenjige
analysis: A disciplined left-arm spinner who troubled big teams; gold on turning tracks.

name: Saurabh Netravalkar
analysis: The Oracle! An engineer who codes wickets; his left-arm swing is genuine quality.

name: Shayan Jahangir
analysis: Gets stuck at the crease too often; needs to improve his strike rotation.

name: Smit Patel
analysis: Former India U19 player, but hasn't had enough game time to justify a spot.

name: Utkarsh Srivastava
analysis: A developmental player; pass for now and save your budget for impact players.

name: Yasir Mohammad
analysis: A squad player; not enough data to suggest he can influence a match here.

name: Akeal Hosein
analysis: Powerplay spin specialist; disciplined, creates pressure, and takes wickets.

name: Alzarri Joseph
analysis: Fast and angry! Hits the deck hard; a strike bowler who breaks partnerships.

name: Andre Russell
analysis: Muscle Russell! Even on slow pitches, his brute force clears the ropes.

name: Brandon King
analysis: Elegant opener; sets the platform well on good batting tracks.

name: Gudakesh Motie
analysis: Underrated gem! Left-arm spin is gold here; varies pace beautifully.

name: Johnson Charles
analysis: Stand and deliver! Hits hard on flat tracks, but struggles if ball moves.

name: Nicholas Pooran
analysis: Cleanest hitter! Destroys leg-spinners; pure match winner on slow turns.

name: Obed McCoy
analysis: Slower ball specialist; his back-of-hand delivery is good for Asian conditions.

name: Romario Shepherd
analysis: Big hitter; bowling can be expensive in Asia, but offers wicket-taking ability.

name: Roston Chase
analysis: The "Glue" man; stabilizes collapses and bowls handy off-spin.

name: Rovman Powell
analysis: Calm captain who hits monster sixes; handles spin surprisingly well.

name: Shai Hope
analysis: Classy but slow; a situational anchor who might stall momentum.

name: Shamar Joseph
analysis: Gabba hero! Raw pace and high energy, but inexperienced in T20s.

name: Sherfane Rutherford
analysis: Played a lot in Asia/PSL; finishes games with serious power.

name: Shimron Hetmyer
analysis: Great player of spin, but fitness and attitude issues make him risky.

name: Blessing Muzarabani
analysis: Tall, hits the deck hard, and difficult to score off; excellent budget pacer.

name: Bradley Evans
analysis: Can bowl decent pace and hit the ball, but a bits-and-pieces player at this level.

name: Brendan Taylor
analysis: Absolute legend, but retired; keep your paddle down unless it's a legends league.

name: Brian Bennett
analysis: A promising youngster, but lacks the experience to handle big match pressure yet.

name: Clive Madande
analysis: A finisher-keeper who has played crucial knocks, but technically limited vs high pace.

name: Dion Myers
analysis: A solid batter but doesn't have the strike rate required for this format.

name: Graeme Cremer
analysis: A legend for Zimbabwe, but he is effectively retired/coaching. Do not buy!

name: Richard Ngarava
analysis: A tall left-arm pacer who swings the new ball; offers great value for the price.

name: Ryan Burl
analysis: Can rip leg-spin and hit massive sixes, but he goes missing in many games.

name: Sikandar Raza
analysis: The spirit of Zimbabwe! Mystery spin, middle order power, and pure passion. Must buy.

name: Tadiwanashe Marumani
analysis: Has talent but hasn't converted it into runs; too risky for a main squad.

name: Tashinga Musekiwa
analysis: A finisher who can bowl, but unproven at the top level.

name: Tinotenda Maposa
analysis: A young seamer who needs more time in the domestic circuit; skip.

name: Tony Munyonga
analysis: A fringe player who hasn't made enough impact to warrant a slot.

name: Wellington Masakadza
analysis: Experienced left-arm spinner, but purely a defensive bowler; won't win matches.
